intro: Mertensia arizonica var. umbratilis, commonly known as Arizona bluebells, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or shaded areas. It has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. The species is part of the Boraginaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental value.
